title: 107_hr2279
content: The "Rural Heritage Conservation Act" may be cited as the short title. Special limitation for certain charitable contributions of eligible farmers and ranchers is outlined in the act. The "Rural Heritage Conservation Act" introduces a special limitation for charitable contributions of capital gain property by eligible farmers or ranchers. The "Rural Heritage Conservation Act" limits the deduction for charitable contributions of capital gain property to 100 percent of the taxpayer's contribution base. Taxpayers can elect to take the deduction for such contributions over a 15-year period. The taxpayer may make a one-time election under this clause, which is irrevocable. An eligible farmer or rancher is defined as a taxpayer whose gross income from farming is at least 51 percent of their total income for the taxable year. The amendments made by this section apply to contributions made in taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act for C corporations with non-publicly traded stock. MODIFICATIONS TO ENCOURAGE CONTRIBUTIONS OF CAPITAL GAIN REAL PROPERTY MADE FOR CONSERVATION PURPOSES. Modifications to encourage contributions of capital gain real property for conservation purposes include an exclusion from percentage limitation and unlimited carryover for certain conservation contributions of capital gain property. The amendments made by this section allow for unlimited carryover of certain conservation contributions, with any excess contribution being carried over to succeeding taxable years. Effective for contributions made in taxable years after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. INCREASE IN CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION LIMIT FOR FARMERS AND RANCHERS DOING BUSINESS IN CORPORATE FORM. The section discusses amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to charitable contribution limits for farmers and ranchers in corporate form. Eligible farmers and ranchers are treated as individuals for qualified conservation contributions, with specific amendments to sections 170(b)(1) and 170(b)(2) of the Code. Effective date for these amendments is also specified. The amendments made by this section apply to donations of qualified conservation contributions made after the enactment of this Act, in taxable years ending after such date.
